coreCitation.description: Basic information about the collection or dataset

$id.description: Unique identifier for the collection or dataset

title.description: Full name of the dataset or project

recordType.description: Distinguishes between records describing collections, and records describing singular datasets

hostedBy.description: Distinguishes between datasets hosted within the organization describing the data, or via another organization

shortDataDescription.description: Short description of the dataset or project

shortGenealogyDescription.description: Notes about how the dataset came to be, if it was inferred from or combined from other datasets

includesDataTypes.description: Optional field for denoting data types, to power interface faceting

bboxPreview.description: Information about the dataset's coordinate system and geographic extent

accessCondition.description: Notes about access conditions, specifically relating to copyright and use restrictions
examples: This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

collectionItems.description: If the record describes a collection, this field is used to link to collection items

dataEndpoints.description: Points to direct access to the dataset

accessedViaURL.description: If the data has a record on a data portal containing additional contextual information, link to that record here

subjectTagging.description: Topic tags to facilitate search and filtering

thematic.description: Used to power interface filtering by theme

otherSubjectAuthorities.description: Place to tag subjects based on authorities not formally encoded in this schema

freeSubjectTags.description: Place for subject tags that don't conform to a defined authority

geographic.description: Used to power interface filtering by geography

geonames.description: The GeoNames geographical database covers all countries and contains over eleven million placenames that are available for download free of charge.

EPSG.description: EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset (also EPSG registry) is a public registry of geodetic datums, spatial reference systems, Earth ellipsoids, coordinate transformations and related units of measurement. Each entity is assigned an EPSG code between 1024-32767.

temporal.description: Used to power interface filtering by date

temporalNotes.description: Used to provide clarity about the temporal details of the dataset

temporalRepresentation.description: Place to indicate the temporal period the data represents. For instance, if a dataset was published in 2019 but the data itself describes life as it were in 1995, aspects described in temporalRepresentation should point to 1995.

temporalType.description: This field indicates whether the temporal extent of this dataset is expressed as a singular date, or as a range.

singularExpressionValue.description: Use this field if the temporal representation is best described as a singular date or year

startRangeValue.description: Use these fields if the temporal representation is best described as a range

value.description: The value entered in this field should indicate the conceptual temporal extent the data represents. For instance, if the collection is comprised of data depicting the various states of the historic shoreline between 1630 and 1995, but was created and published in 2019, the value of this field should be 1630. The 'datePublished' and 'temporalNotes' fields can be used together to provide any further clarification or nuance to the temporal details of the dataset.

endRangeValue.description: Use these fields if the temporal representation is best described as a range

value.description: The value entered in this field should indicate the conceptual temporal extent the data represents. For instance, if the collection is comprised of data depicting the various states of the historic shoreline between 1630 and 1995, but was created and published in 2019, the value of this field should be 1995. The 'datePublished' and 'temporalNotes' fields can be used together to provide any further clarification or nuance to the temporal details of the dataset.

temporalPublication.description: Used to indicate details about when the data was published.  Any other date-based information can be added in `temporalNotes` or `temporalRepresentation` for clarity.

temporalType.description: This field indicates whether the temporal extent of this dataset's publication date is expressed as a singular date, or as a range.

singleExpressionValue.description: Use this field if the publication date is best described by a singluar date or year

startRangeValue.description: Use these fields if the publication date is best described as a range

value.description: The value entered in this field should connote information about when the data was published. Any other date-based information can be added in `temporalNotes` or `temporalRepresentation` for clarity.

endRangeValue.description: Use these fields if the publication date is best described as a range

value.description: The value entered in this field should connote information about when the data was published. Any other date-based information can be added in `temporalNotes` or `temporalRepresentation` for clarity.

dataBiography.description: Background information about the who, what, where, why and how the data came to be, designed to place focus on human lives. If information about these fields is not available, these prompts can be used as conversation starters about why this information wasn't previously considered.

sampling.description: Used to provide context on sampling methodology for this dataset

universe.description: Information about the universe the dataset describes

sampleSize.description: Notes about the dataset's sample size

sampleSizeReasons.description: Explanation for this choice of sample size

knownSampleSizeProblems.description: Place to mention known problems or considerations related to sample size and method.

marginOfError.description: Place to note considerations related to margins of error.

privacy.description: Used to provide notes about privacy considerations surrounding this dataset

aggregationProblems.description: If there are known issues or considerations related to the way the data is aggregated, describe them here.

consent.description: Describe the degree to which the people included in this dataset knew about, agreed, and understood how their data would be used.

anonymization.description: If this data was masked or anonymized in any way, please describe that process here, including how measures of genuine privacy are being assured.

privacyIssues.description: Are there any known privacy issues or considerations related to this dataset?

representation.description: Used to provide context about who is and is not represented in the dataset

whoIncluded.description: Explanation of who was included in this dataset

whoLeftOut.description: Explanation of who was not included in this dataset

dataCollection.description: Used to provide context on data collection methodology

whoCollected.description: Place for notes about who was involved in the data collection process

startDate.description: Place for notes about when data collection began

endDate.description: Place for notes about when data collection ended

whoConceived.description: Place for notes about who was responsible for the conception of the data collection project

whoDesigned.description: Place for notes about Who designed the survey or data model

whoIncluded.description: Place for notes about who was included in the conception and design of the survey or data model, and choices made around this topic

representation.description: Place for notes about the degree to which the communities who this data are about were included in the conception or collection process

collectionConditions.description: Place for notes about any known conditions surrounding the collection process which could have possibly impacted results. Examples could be global pandemic, housing insecurity, documentation status, and so on.

collectorsLocations.description: Place for notes about the degree to which data collectors were from the same communities in which the data were being collected

collectionMethods.description: Place for notes about the methodology used for data collection

miscountRisk.description: Place for notes about historic patterns of demographic under or overcounts, as they relate to the impact of the data being described

missingData.description: Place for notes about any issues with missing values in the data, and possible reasons contributing to missing or null values

funding.description: Place to describe or point to how this data were funded, who the funders were, what the funding requirements or stipulations were, and what the original purpose of the data was for

potentialBenefit.description: If there are people who potentially benefit from this data, or have some stake in its quality, use this space to comment on who, how, and why

potentialHarm.description: If there are people who could potentially be harmed by this data, or have some stake in its quality, use this space to comment on who, how, and why

resourceConstellation.description: Datasets or data projects are often not useful on their own. Often, we need an entire constellation of supporting resources to make sense of the data we find. The information in this section can be added to as more learning materials become available.

suggestedEntryPoints.description: Reference to the most logical place for someone new to this dataset to begin to understand how to work with it

notes.description: Place to note why this is a recommended starting place

codebooks.description: Reference to any codebooks or data dictionaries intended to aid interpretation of the data's attributes or field names

maintainedBy.description: Person or organization responsible for maintaining and providing access to the codebook

notes.description: Place to put helpful notes or information about finding, using or interpreting the codebook

publishedWorks.description: Reference to related blogs, articles, books, data visualizations or other published research based on this data.

notes.description: Place to note how this resource is relelvant

tutorials.description: Reference to guides, tutorials, Jupyter notebooks, or any resource with people-centered instructions on how to work with, use and understand this data

notes.description: Place to note how this resource is relelvant

dataLifecycle.description: Human beings often make changes to data during the process of working with and making sense of it. The context in this section is aimed at painting a fuller picture of the actions taken by other humans, in order to help someone understand how they might want to use the data.

acquisition.description: Used to describe where the data originated from, if it was derived from other from other data sources

ingredients.description: Used to provide relational links and notes about relationship quality to the 'ingredient' datasets this dataset was created from

$id.description: Each item object in the array refers to a unique ingredient used to create the new dataset. This field denotes the ID for the input ingredient dataset.

type.description: If this ingredient alone was improved upon to create new new dataset, select 'linearPredecessor'. If it was combined with other datasets to create the new dataset, select 'compositeIngredient'. This distinction powers the way the project is presented to the user in the catalog interface.

notes.description: This field is used to qualify the data genealogy between the stated datasets, if it is not clear

description.description: Information about how the dataset has been described, who described it, based on what information

contextProvider.description: Person describing this dataset or project

relationshipToData.description: Person's relationship to dataset or project

contextOnBehalfOf.description: If the person filling out the context is different than the person responsbile for the creation or processing of the dataset or project, note that here

relationshipToData.description: Person's relationship to dataset or project

contextPublicationDate.description: Date this context was first made available

metadataSchema.description: Links out to full LMEC Data Description Schema

missingContext.description: In cases where fields were left blank because the context contributor did not know the answer, this is a place for the contributor to name that, and possibly provide some information on why they think this information is not available

criticalContext.description: Array of metadata field names where the value provided in the context document should be elevated to high prominence in the discovery environment, to avoid important information being buried. Will vary dataset to dataset / project to project.

maintenance.description: Information about who is responsible for updating and maintaining the dataset

officialMaintainer.description: Person or organization responsible for maintaining the dataset

maintenanceFrequency.description: Regularity with which this dataset is updated. Example values could be 'None', 'Every Monday at Midnight', 'Annually', 'Unknown'

typicalUpdates.description: If this data is regularly updated, describe the typical nature of the changes

manipulation.description: Used to refer to documentation provided by the person who manipulated the data, about the human choices involved in processing this dataset. Contributors of READMEs or other tutorial-based docs should be encouraged to format their descriptions in a way that someone who has never encountered this data before could reproduce the process. Where possible, contributors should write step-by-step explanations in chronological order, providing audio or image supplements for additional clarity and accessibility.

records.description: Links out to READMEs, tutorials or other documentation contributed by the data processor

accessURL.description: Direct link to access the process documentation

author.description: Name of person who authored the process documentation

actors.description: Place to note information about the humans involved in processing this dataset

name.description: Name of person who processed this data

notes.description: Notes about the relationship of the processor to the data repository hosting the data, and information about how the records available about processing were procured

missingProcessingInformation.description: What is unknown about the process for cleaning, joining, analyzing, visualizing within this project that leaves meaningful gaps in understanding how to interpret or use it again

process.description: Notes about the general contours of the process, lessons learned, reasoning, thought process and forewarnings to future data users

shortProcessDescription.description: A clear, sequential overview of all steps taken and the reasons for making changes or carrying out processing should be provided here

successes.description: General explanation of how steps taken were beneficial to the improvement of this data for public use

challenges.description: What was difficult about this project, known hangups, missing information, assumptions made, guesses, practical but questionable steps taken

sandtraps.description: Forewarnings or words-to-the wise for someone else wanting to work with this data or project
